stream_context.summary: Kaze works live on the new Oil Blarrg boss fight: testing AI that flees when Mario rides it, adding damage flashing, balancing speed vs. size, and redesigning the arena from a round oil barrel to a tilted warehouse-cave filled with oil. He also troubleshoots Fast64 issues, discusses ROM size limits and streamed music, and chats with viewers about philosophy, ads, and moving house.
level: Oil Blarrg Boss Arena (mid-late game industrial world)

development_findings.summary: The Oil Blarrg boss now flees from Mario; its speed and turn rate scale with remaining size/health.
development_findings.quote: He turns around… this is perfect, it looks good. I’m going to make him zoom around quicker when he’s smaller.

development_findings.summary: Damage feedback will use a primitive-color flash combiner; Kaze implemented mouth glow and plans an orange flash instead of blue.
development_findings.quote: If he turned this color for damage… maybe orange because the point-one blue doesn’t really add much.

development_findings.summary: Soap bars are the only way to harm the boss; a janitor Koopa will toss sparkling, bouncing soap bars from a side cage onto the arena.
development_findings.quote: I definitely want the strike workers to shoot them to you… the soap is sparkling and it’s going to be thrown in.

development_findings.summary: Remaining tasks: make grills rise/fall, continuous oil-floor damage, soap depletion speed, boss teleport after three hits, particles, and full arena art pass.
Arena re-themed: rectangular, half-cave half-metal warehouse that appears to be sinking, solving earlier visual problems with hexagonal oil barrel walls.
development_findings.quote: What if it was a mix of a cave and a warehouse? We’d have metal at the bottom and cave at the top.

development_findings.summary: Game ROM is already 45.9 MB; about 70 % is streamed music. 64 MB hard limit forces them to convert or compress future tracks.
development_findings.quote: We have an issue of just not having any more space for music soon.

development_findings.summary: Kaze prefers reusing unused object variables over expanding structs to avoid memory overhead and keep static object sizes.
development_findings.quote: That would expand the object struct… we would lose four bytes for every object in the entire world.

development_findings.summary: Performance has been ‘massively’ improved off-stream so the hack will still run on EverDrive hardware.
development_findings.quote: Don’t worry, we’re going to keep it N64-compatible.

context_findings.summary: YouTube income nearly doubled after ad-block crackdown; Kaze is pleased and supports the change.
context_findings.quote: If it means I make more money I support this ad-block thing… it’s like twice what I usually make.

context_findings.summary: Kaze and Zeina bought a house and move on 23 Oct; he jokes about working from a dungeon-like office.
context_findings.quote: We bought a house guys… I will literally work from a dungeon, no windows, no sunlight.

context_findings.summary: He sees swearing as normal and critiques American attitudes toward profanity.
context_findings.quote: Swears being a bad thing is such an American concept. I don’t give a shit.

context_findings.summary: Rants against ‘chores’ in modern game design and gatekeeping mechanics (e.g., key/character locks).
context_findings.quote: Video games are not supposed to be chores!

context_findings.summary: Streaming helps him focus on straightforward tasks; complex coding is done off-stream.
context_findings.quote: It makes it easier to stay focused on simple tasks… when I work on actually complex things I probably work faster off-stream.

context_findings.summary: Philosophical tangent: calls Immanuel Kant ‘a fucking asshole’, revealing his blunt worldview.
context_findings.quote: There’s a difference between me saying I want something this way and me saying I think it’d be good… Emanuel Kant is a fucking asshole.

biobak.summary: Created and iteratively refined the Oil Blarrg model; discussed adding eyebrows, switch bones, and texture tweaks.
biobak.quote: Oh, nice Biobak. Do you have an idea of communicating the player into them attacking the block yet?

biobak.summary: Asked technical combiner questions, prompting Kaze’s mini-lecture on color math.

badub.summary: Composed a new song for the Boombox Koopa enemies; Kaze showcased it briefly on stream.
badub.quote: We have a new song for the boombox koopas that Badub made. It’s really good.

key_stories.title: Designing the Oil Blarrg Boss
key_stories.summary: Kaze transforms an ordinary Thwomp-like idea into a multifaceted fight: the boss flees in panic, players ride soap to shrink it, and the arena evolves with rising grills and hazardous oil.
key_stories.challenge: Create an engaging, mechanically clear boss that fits the strike-themed factory world.
key_stories.process: Implemented AI fleeing logic, damage flashing, and animations; brainstormed arena shapes, janitor Koopa soap delivery, and environmental hazards live on stream.
key_stories.outcome: Core behaviour works, but visuals, grill logic, particles, and soap spawning remain; Kaze plans to finish off-stream and polish Monday.
key_stories.key_quote: Everything that’s really missing from this block boss fight is that it needs to run away from you… and we need the janitor to toss soap bars.

key_stories.title: The 64 MB Squeeze
key_stories.summary: As development nears course 12, the ROM has reached 45.9 MB—mostly due to streamed music—forcing hard choices about audio fidelity.
key_stories.challenge: Stay within the N64’s 64 MB cartridge ceiling without sacrificing quality.
key_stories.process: Analysed file table, realised 70 % is music; discussed converting tracks to sequences, using mono, or looping small WAV riffs.
key_stories.outcome: No final decision yet; Kaze estimates freeing 1–2 MB quickly but bigger optimisations needed.
key_stories.key_quote: Two-thirds of the ROM is just music that we cannot compress.

key_stories.title: Ad-Block Windfall
key_stories.summary: Changes in YouTube’s stance on ad blockers unexpectedly doubled Kaze’s channel revenue in a single month.
key_stories.process: Noticed watch time up 50 % but revenue up nearly 100 %; attributes jump to viewers seeing ads.
key_stories.outcome: Extra funds ease personal finances; Kaze jokes he can afford Premium and supports the crackdown.
key_stories.key_quote: This month I made so much more money… honestly, if it means I make more money I support this ad-block thing.

open_questions.context: Kaze proposed a janitor Koopa in a side cage tossing bouncing soap bars but hasn’t settled on visibility, timing, or player communication.
questions: How will you ensure players immediately notice and understand the soap source?
What animations or cues will the janitor have?
Could multiple workers supply soap to scale difficulty?

open_questions.context: He plans for grills to raise/lower after missed soap phases to punish players but hasn’t coded it.
questions: What exact rules govern when grills drop or rise?
How will this tie into boss health phases?
What feedback will players get before a grill changes?

open_questions.context: ROM size crisis centres on large streamed tracks; several ideas floated but no plan.
questions: Which specific tracks are candidates for sequence conversion?
How will quality loss be judged acceptable?
Could dynamic streaming or bank-swapping be used?

open_questions.context: Kaze claims ‘sick performance improvement’ that keeps game EverDrive compatible but gave no details.
questions: Are there remaining bottlenecks on real hardware?
How do toolchain choices (Fast64, decomp) affect performance?

open_questions.context: Complex tasks are moved off-stream; unclear how the distributed team coordinates assets and code.
questions: What does a typical off-stream work session look like for each member?
How are asset hand-offs and version control handled?
How do time-zones and Kaze’s move to a new house affect collaboration?

open_questions.context: Kaze mentioned having a full-time job and unpredictable blockers; no timeline given.
questions: What internal milestones are set for remaining courses and bosses?
Is there a target year or event for release?
